meanings.definition: A high point of land or rock projecting into the sea or other water beyond the line of coast.
meanings.sent1: The rugged promontories offered stunning views of the ocean.
meanings.sent2: We hiked to the promontories to see the waves crashing against the rocks.
meanings.sent3: The seagulls gathered on the promontories, enjoying the breeze.
meanings.sent4: The promontories stood like guardians, protecting the coastline.
meanings.sent5: The sun setting behind the promontories painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: A prominent mass of land overlooking or projecting into a lowland.
meanings.sent1: From the promontories, we could see the entire valley below.
meanings.sent2: The castle was built on the promontories to overlook the surrounding fields.
meanings.sent3: The promontories cast long shadows over the meadows at sunset.
meanings.sent4: The promontories loomed over the village like silent giants.
meanings.sent5: The promontories provided a perfect vantage point for birdwatching.
